Safety: Problems: Suspected abuse/neglect Progress: SW was notified by bedside RN that NJ Division of Child Protection and Permanency (DCPP) called. SW spoke with DCPP Nurse Rochelle Rom (856-745-9059) and Investigator Jason LaGamba by phone. Per Rochelle, a hotline call was placed yesterday 9/6 and DCPP must initiate contact within 24 hours. DCPP plans to visit this afternoon around 3p to notify the family of the call and investigation. DCPP Investigator Jason LaGamba and DCPP Nurse Rochelle Rom arrived to CICU. SW and FLC MD Annie Gula met with DCPP representatives together to provide background medical information around underlying diagnoses and current admission. DCPP received report that patient was admitted due to sepsis from pressure wound; medical team confirmed this was not reason for admission. Per medical team, reason for admission was gastroenteritis and dehydration. MD Gula reviewed that GI illness and dehydration impacted Jamal so severely due to his underlying conditions.

DCPP to complete home assessment with the family and will also visit pt's 14yo sister, who is currently with 26yo older sister. Per DCPP, this investigation will not impede Jamal's discharge home with mother.
DCPP has 60 days to complete the investigation.
